result.execSummary:
The defendant Darius X. Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Darius X. Scott is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Darius X. Scott was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Darius X. Scott was found guilty of Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Darius X. Scott was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: From bond forfeited 4/29/15 - per Court Order on 11/25/15.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  DE appears with Atty Hans Koesser.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  910 -   DE seeks to reverse the forfeiture of $2500 cash bond. ST objects. Arguments heard. Court orders the forfeiture be revised to pay the remaining $940.25 owed in costs to the court. As the DE did not appear as ordered, the $1559.75 difference remains with Kenosha County.
Hearing at 11-25-2015 08:30 am
Hearing scheduled re: bond money. NTBS by clerk to all parties.
from def. re bond money.  Letter given to Judge Wilk w/file.
$1940.25 due in 30 days or civil judgment.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

11:07 a.m. - Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Hans Koesser.  Amended Information filed.  Count 1 is now misdemeanor battery.  Plea of no contest to counts 1-3; found guilty by the Court.  On the motion of the State, count 4 is dismissed.  Court orders a $250.00 fine plus costs on each count (drug surcharge on count 3), due in 30 days or civil judgment.  NO DNA SURCHARGE.  Appeal rights given.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Hans Koesser.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:23am-  Matter heard with 15CF258.  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Koesser is requesting an adjournment as he was recently appointed.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Bond continued.
Atty Hans Koesser

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  4:13pm-  Matter heard with 15CF258.  Motion to withdraw filed by Attorney Edwards.  DE has failed to meet w/ Attorney Edwards.  Motion to withdraw as counsel is granted effective upon new appointment of public defender.  Status conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.
to Withdraw as Counsel - filed by Attorney Hilary Edwards
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Hilary Edwards. Clerk LE. Case trails 15CF258. Further proceedings on 7-22-15 @ 3:30pm. Bond continued.

Further proceedings on April 30, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Further proceedings on April 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

1:44  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person. Clerk LE. Referred to intake court for futher disposition on 4-2-15 @ 1:00 pm.   Warrant vacated.Further proce. Trailing 15CF258.  $1000.00 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry) continued posted.

Continued Posted

Warrant served, $1000 cash bond posted.  Return on warrant 3-24-15 at 1:00 before Intake Commissioner.

Def. spoke to Intake Court clerk to schedule a voluntary appearance.  Clerk advised def. to contact Atty Hilary Edwards, as she needs to arrange the hearing date with the clerk.  Def. said he has left her phone messages  on 3/5/15, 3/6/15, and 3/7/15 and has not received a return call from Atty Edwards.  Clerk advised def. to keep attempting to contact Atty Edwards.
bail/bond forfeiture - cash bond

Attorney Hilary D. Edwards appeared.  Attorney Jason Robert Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: DE does not appear; Atty Edwards does not have an explanation for his non-appearance. The Court orders the $2,500 cash bond on deposit be forfeited and issues a warrant with a $1,000 cash bond.
to Adjourn Jury Trial - filed by ADA Jason Zapf
to Withdraw as Counsel - filed by Attorney Hilary Edwards

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:02am-  Victim rights compliance.  State has filed a motion to adjourn the trial.  Attorney Edwards has filed a motion to withdraw as counsel.  Court will not grant Attorney Edwards' motion for reasons set forth on the record.  Court grants State's motion to adjourn the trial.  Final pre-trial adjourned to March 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:53am-  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is not resolved.  DE is requesting matter be set for trial.  Court sets matter for trial.  Court orders all witness lists & motions in limine be filed by 12/20/2014.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:43am-  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Edwards is requesting an adjournment - State needs to discuss a possible resolution w/ the PPPD officer.  State joins in request.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial adjourned to November 11, 2014 at 10:30 am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Final pre-trial on October 2, 2014 at 09:00 am.
